The Largest Hackathon in the Southwest

Hack Arizona is about bringing together the most talented undergraduates to represent the burgeoning tech ecosystem that is appearing in the southwest and across the country.

Hosted at the University of Arizona, over 400 participants will build software and hardware projects from start to finish in under 36 hours amongst their peers, mentors and company sponsors.

FAQ

  • I am still confused, what are we hacking?

    "Hacking" has changed in recent vocabulary to mean building projects quickly and iteratively.

  • What if I don't have a team or an idea?

    No problem! It is more common than you would think to attend a hackathon without a solid idea or team. Many people still find great success. The hacker community is friendly and enthusiastic.

  • What can I build?

    Anything you want: web apps, iOS apps, a website, cloud software, robotics, even a voice-controller catapult. Be inventive. This is your weekend.

  • Who can attend?

    Any undergraduate student (meaning enrolled in an undergraduate program) who is also over the age of 18.

  • How much does it cost?

    Absolutely nothing. We provide free meals over the weekend and company sponsors will be handing out swag and prizes.

  • What should I bring?

    Besides the obvious laptop or desktop, a sleeping bag, toothbrush and other basic amendities are things to consider.

  • How do I get there?

    If you a student attending a university or college within Arizona, we are currently working to develop a program to reimburse travel expenses. Unfortunately, we cannot offer the same for the rest of our atendees from out of state.

  • How big can teams be?

    No more than 5. It becomes difficult to manage and execute a project with a team larger than that. We highly recommend building a team of at least 3. One man shows are frowned upon.

  • Where on campus is it?

    We are currently in pre-registration. If we approve your application you will be provided with detailed itinerary and directions.

  • What are the rules?

    Pretty simple. Come and build cool stuff and don't be a jerk. More info here.

Arizona Stadium

Tucson, AZ
